CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.
1. PC71BM - This is a specific material name mentioned in the paragraph. It is a type of fullerene derivative, commonly used as an electron transport material in organic solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. processability
2. backbone planarity
3. charge carrier mobility
4. optimal morphology
5. bulk heterojunction film (implied property: property of the film as a whole)
6. PC71BM (implied property: property of PC71BM material)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. charge carrier mobility
2. optimal morphology (implied property of the bulk heterojunction film)
3. PC71BM (implied property: property of PC71BM material)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

1. Processability: This refers to the ease with which a material can be processed or manufactured into a final product. In this context, it refers to the ability of the bulk heterojunction film to be processed efficiently and effectively.
2. Backbone planarity: This refers to the flatness or planarity of the molecular backbone of the IDT (Interdonna-Dewettel-Treffz) and NT (Naphthalenediimide-Thiophene) units in the bulk heterojunction film.
3. Charge carrier mobility: This is a measure of how easily and quickly charge carriers (electrons or holes) can move through a material. In this context, it refers to the ability of the bulk heterojunction film to transport charge carriers efficiently.
4. Optimal morphology: This refers to the ideal physical structure or shape of the bulk heterojunction film. In this context, it refers to the structure that allows for the best performance of the film in terms of processability, backbone planarity, and charge carrier mobility.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Charge carrier mobility: This is a material property that refers to the ability of the bulk heterojunction film to transport charge carriers efficiently.
2. Processability: This is a material property that refers to the ease with which the bulk heterojunction film can be processed efficiently and effectively.
3. Optimal morphology: This is a material property that refers to the ideal physical structure or shape of the bulk heterojunction film that allows for the best performance in terms of charge carrier mobility and processability.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Charge carrier mobility |
| Processability |
| Optimal morphology |
